description:
Using Nova Folsom w/ Libvirt.

When booting an instance with metadata defined I'm seeing an empty meta.js once I log into the running instance.

The root cause appears to be that we now use jsonutils.dumps to convert the metadata dict to a string. This would be fine except that jsonutils.dumps converts the string to unicode as well which is apparently incompatible with utils.execute '/usr/bin/tee' which we use to inject the meta.js file into the image.
title: meta.js injection fails... utils.execute tee doesn't like unicode

comments.content:
Using Nova Folsom w/ Libvirt.

When booting an instance with metadata defined I'm seeing an empty meta.js once I log into the running instance.

The root cause appears to be that we now use jsonutils.dumps to convert the metadata dict to a string. This would be fine except that jsonutils.dumps converts the string to unicode as well which is apparently incompatible with '/usr/bin/tee' which we use to inject the meta.js file into the image.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dan-prince

comments.content:
Hmmm. I think I diagnosed this incorrectly. If it were unicode then the test case I wrote here should have caught it (not yet landed):

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10975/3/nova/tests/test_virt.py

I'm still seeing this issue... but not always. I'm not thinking when I see it I may have been booting from an image snapshot.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dan-prince
